snippet: The American promise to build 18 Ebola treatment centers has been stalled by, among other things, broken equipment and numerous holes on an airport runway.
abstract: Construction of 18 American-built treatment centers in Liberia, center of West Africa's Ebola crisis, is still long way off, two weeks after Pres Obama pledged to help address epidemic; efforts to build centers have been stalled by variety of factors, but even once structures are built, challenge of staffing them may prove to be biggest obstacle.
lead_paragraph: The American promise to build 18 Ebola treatment centers has been stalled by, among other things, broken equipment and numerous holes on an airport runway.

headline.main: U.S. Aid Effort in Liberia Barely Off the Ground as Ebola Rages
headline.print_headline: Setbacks on Ebola: Contamination in Dallas, Slow Aid in Liberia

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
